description: The Figgy Maple Bourbon Fizz is a perfect drink for the holiday season. It tastes like Christmas in your mouth! This recipe will teach you how to make this delicious cocktail at&nbsp;home, so you don't have to go out and buy it from your local bar or restaurant.
keywords: Figgy Maple Bourbon Fizz Cocktail Recipe
How To Figgy Maple Bourbon Fizz
name: Figgy Maple Bourbon Fizz
recipeIngredient: A squeeze of lemon juice, plus 2 lemon twists, for garnish

recipeInstructions.name: To infuse the bourbon, take a mason jar and fill it halfway with fresh figs.
recipeInstructions.text: To infuse the bourbon, take a mason jar and fill it halfway with fresh figs.

recipeInstructions.name: Top with bourbon to the rim of the jar, seal and let sit for 5-7 days, gently stirring it once a day. Once infused, strain bourbon through a tea strainer and transfer it to another clean jar for storage (the figs can be used to make a boozy jam or discarded).
recipeInstructions.text: Top with bourbon to the rim of the jar, seal and let sit for 5-7 days, gently stirring it once a day. Once infused, strain bourbon through a tea strainer and transfer it to another clean jar for storage (the figs can be used to make a boozy jam or discarded).

recipeInstructions.name: In an old-fashioned glass, pour 1 teaspoon of maple syrup, a squeeze of fresh lemon juice, and 2-3 dashes of bitters.
recipeInstructions.text: In an old-fashioned glass, pour 1 teaspoon of maple syrup, a squeeze of fresh lemon juice, and 2-3 dashes of bitters.

recipeInstructions.name: Muddle the ingredients until thoroughly mixed. Add 1½ ounces of fig-infused bourbon, pour the contents into a cocktail shaker full of ice, and shake vigorously for 15 seconds.
recipeInstructions.text: Muddle the ingredients until thoroughly mixed. Add 1½ ounces of fig-infused bourbon, pour the contents into a cocktail shaker full of ice, and shake vigorously for 15 seconds.

recipeInstructions.name: Strain the drink into an old-fashioned glass over ice, top with a float of ginger beer, and stir gently.

recipeInstructions.name: Poke a cocktail spear through the halved fig so that it rests on the rim of the glass, and serve.
